title: American_Top_40_1975_September_13th
description:
"From the rocky coast of Maine to the sandy shores of Hawaii, these are the nation's top hits every week on American Top 40. My name's Casey Kasem."

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

As of this broadcast:

There is a debut song from the soundtrack to one of the top grossing films of all time. It trails only The Godfather, The Sound Of Music, and Gone With The Wind.

Casey tells all about Leon Russell.

Casey answers the question, "What song in the rock era has made the top 40 in the most versions?" Two songs tie at five versions each.

A listener asks, What artist has had the most big hits in the shortest span of time?" This artist had 36 top 10's in 3 years, beating Elvis and The Beatles.
